stories.text: The Western democracies seem fairly serious about imposing serious economic sanctions on Russia. The Russian government is responding with the equivalent of capital controls, to prop up its currency and limit the possibility of panic and bank runs. It seems likely that Russians will, for awhile, try to circumvent some of those sanctions by using cryptocurrencies. For instance, a Russian citizen, if they think the ruble will lose more value than it already has, might try to trade rubles for a cryptocurrency, right now. How would the Western democracies respond to that? Will we see greater efforts to regulate cryptocurrencies?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is the war in Ukraine the end of freedom for cryptocurrencies?
Are tech interviews broken – or is the cruelty the point?

stories.text:
So I'm a pretty new HN user and I enjoy the content and conversation one can have here.

But I feel like it's a struggle to find the right content for you (reloading 'new' 20 times a day is a no-go). Even following your own conversations and threads is not super user-friendly - I discovered hnnotify to be alerted by email for each answer, which is working great.

Is there any way to ease the HN experience that are widely spread in the community? (automatic filtering of new posts by topics, mobile experience, ...)
stories.title: Ask HN: What is your advice to make the most of HN?
